meaningMnemonic:
Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. 

The kanji itself means <kanji>boil</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to boil something</vocabulary>. This is a transitive verb, so it's used when you put something into a pot and boil it up.
readingMnemonic: The reading is the same as the one you learned with the kanji.
